text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Kuwait's press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Foreign minister reiterates Kuwait will not normalise ties with Israel before an Arab-Israeli peace settelment is in place.
- Trade on Kuwait Stock Exchange falls on Wednesday.
- Information Minister Sheikh Saud Nasser al-Sabah says government has objections to broadcasting parliamentary debates on state television.
- Kuwaiti state-owned holdings firm considers four Syria projects, finance minister says.
- Agriculture authority reopens a dairy plant destroyed during Iraq's 1990-91 occupation of Kuwait.
- Kuwait to reduce a 15-year term set for foreign wives of Kuwaitis to acquire Kuwaiti nationality to 10 years for non-Gulf nationals and five for Gulf nationals, deputies say.
- MPs study bid to boost role of private sector in the national economy.
